item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, September 17, 2024 at 9:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Fixing an Elgato HD60 S HDMI capture device with the help of Ghidra (203 points | 13 comments)
2. Chain of Thought Empowers Transformers to Solve Inherently Serial Problems (65 points | 29 comments)
3. Show HN: Void, an open-source Cursor/GitHub Copilot alternative (124 points | 51 comments)
4. Why to Not Write a Book (125 points | 69 comments)
5. Chain of Thought Empowers Transformers to Solve Inherently Serial Problems (154 points | 67 comments)

7. FreeBSD 13.4-Release Announcement (129 points | 29 comments)
8. Launch HN: Silurian (YC S24) – Simulate the Earth (287 points | 130 comments)
9. ChessDream, a place for chess players to improve (5 points | discuss)
10. Amazon tells employees to return to office five days a week (1125 points | 1237 comments)
11. 47-year-old Voyager 1 fired up thrusters it hasn't used in decades (102 points | 39 comments)
12. Bionicle – my actual part in its origins (2015) (33 points | 7 comments)
13. rainfrog – a database management TUI for Postgres (45 points | 12 comments)
14. Franzelio: Draw Lines. Make Music. Share Your Instrument (78 points | 29 comments)

16. A Spreadsheet and a Debugger Walk into a Shell (172 points | 8 comments)

18. Stepwise selection of variables in regression is Evil (5 points | discuss)
19. We fine-tuned an LLM to triage and fix insecure code (35 points | 24 comments)
20. Titan Submersible Marine Board of Investigation (60 points | 19 comments)
21. Mecanum Wheel (47 points | 20 comments)
22. Dissecting the gzip format (2011) (52 points | 14 comments)
23. Intel foundry business to make custom chip for Amazon, chipmaker's shares jump (132 points | 54 comments)
24. Master Hexagonal Architecture in Rust (52 points | 49 comments)
25. Michigan Micro Mote (M3) makes history as the smallest computer (2015) (24 points | 4 comments)
26. The Pragmatic Programmer for Machine Learning (140 points | 21 comments)
27. Intel lost the Sony Playstation business to AMD (225 points | 148 comments)
28. Datomic and Content Addressable Techniques (140 points | 30 comments)
29. Apple Watch sleep apnea detection gets FDA approval (391 points | 275 comments)
30. Fair: A Go library for serving resources fairly (193 points | 36 comments)
